Message.Issue: Implement IDisposable on 'AsyncResult' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ManualResetEvent'. If 'AsyncResult' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Add [Serializable] to 'BusinessException' as this type implements ISerializable.
Add [Serializable] to 'ConfigException' as this type implements ISerializable.
Add [Serializable] to 'DataAccessException' as this type implements ISerializable.
Add [Serializable] to 'DependencyException' as this type implements ISerializable.

Implement IDisposable on 'GenericDaoProvider' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'NoDao'. If 'GenericDaoProvider' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'IocProvider' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'WindsorDI', 'SingletonDI'. If 'IocProvider' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Add [Serializable] to 'LoggingException' as this type implements ISerializable.

Implement IDisposable on 'SimpleDaoProvider' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'NoDao'. If 'SimpleDaoProvider' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

'SingleThreadTaskScheduler' contains field 'SingleThreadTaskScheduler._cancellationToken' that is of IDisposable type: 'CancellationTokenSource'. Change the Dispose method on 'SingleThreadTaskScheduler' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

'SingleThreadTaskScheduler' contains field 'SingleThreadTaskScheduler._tasks' that is of IDisposable type: 'BlockingCollection<Task>'. Change the Dispose method on 'SingleThreadTaskScheduler' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'NoDao' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'NoDao.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

'SqlClientCnnFactory.SqlClientCnnFactory()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
SqlClientCnnFactory..ctor() SqlClientCnnFactory.get_ConnectionString():String

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'SingletonDI' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'SingletonDI.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'WindsorDI' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'WindsorDI.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

'Log4netErrorHandler.ExceptionSummary.get()' creates an exception of type 'LoggingException', an exception type that should not be raised in a property. If this exception instance might be raised, use a different exception type, convert this property into a method, or change this property's logic so that it no longer raises an exception.

Rule.Name: Disposable fields should be disposed
Rule.Description: If a type that implements IDisposable owns fields that also implement IDisposable, the encapsulating type's Dispose() implementation should call Dispose() on each disposable field.
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains field {1} that is of IDisposable type: {2}. Change the Dispose method on {0} to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Do not raise exceptions in unexpected locations
Rule.Description: Do not explicitly raise exceptions from unexpected locations. There are some methods, such as Equals and GetHashCode, which users do not expect to raise exceptions. Therefore calls to these methods are not commonly wrapped in try catch blocks.
Rule.Resolution: {0} creates an exception of type {1}, an exception type that should not be raised in a property. If this exception instance might be raised, use a different exception type, convert this property into a method, or change this property's logic so that it no longer raises an exception.

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on {0} or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
